author: jens4601
content:
I think that's something that can be avoided by having a fork that intentionally breaks consensus, then either undoes that change or shuts down (automatically) after 1 day, which could be with a 50/50 chance. As far as I can tell the end result of that should be a loss of finality until we get above the 2/3 threshold again due to slashing and/or the automatic undoing of the change. That way the majority chain is pre-destined to loose after some time.

Though I don't know how many insights you'd be able to get out of that.
